data.title: About Us/Contact Us
data.text:
Atlanta69 is next-generation television. With some of the most dynamic and buzzworthy shows on network TV, Atlanta69 is home to hard-hitting investigations with the team at "48 Hours," side-splitting laughs from "The Neighborhood" and "Two & A Half Men," along with action-filled HBCU College football and basketball -- not to mention America's funniest game show, "Family Feud." From hard-hitting daytime court shows to hysterical late-night comedies, Atlanta69 is as diverse and inclusive as the city we represent.

And we're just getting started.

Atlanta69 is owned by CBS News & Stations, a division of Paramount Global. WUPA-TV officially entered the Atlanta market on September 1, 1995, after the old WVEU-TV was acquired from BCG Communications, which held the license since the station's original sign-on in 1981.

Advertise on Atlanta69

Our solutions make it easy to develop marketing programs that connect you with qualified buyers and make the cash register ring. Contact Jim Perry for more information.

Contact Atlanta69

Atlanta69 studios are open during business hours of 8:30 am-5:30 pm Monday-Friday and are located at 2700 Northeast Expressway, Building A, Atlanta, GA, 30345. The office is closed on major national holidays.

Directions

Take I-85 to Shallowford Road. Turn onto the southbound access road. Proceed for Â½ mile and turn right into the Phoenix Business Park. After winding up the drive, Atlanta 69 is in the only building on the left. The front entrance is underneath the awning.

For immediate online closed captioning or audio description concerns or complaints call David Cruickshanks by phone 404-325-6929, fax 404-633-4567, or e-mail WUPAWebCaptions@wupatv.com
